MainMenuConfs: 0: Are you sure you want to backup the save data for every user on this system? This can take an *extremely* long time!
SettingsDescriptions: 0: Sets the working directory for JKSV. The default value for this is `sdmc:/JKSV`.
1: Allows you to remove titles from the blacklist.
2: Includes device, or shared saves, with users.
3: Creates a backup automatically when restoring another.
4: Auto-names backups and skips the keyboard.
5: Automatically uploads backups to remote and deletes them locally.
6: Keeps the local backup created when auto upload is enabled instead of deleting it.
7: Always uses Application IDs for export folder names.
8: Whether or not holding [A] for three seconds is required to delete backups.
9: Whether or not holding [A] for three seconds is required to restore backups.
10: Whether or not holding [A] for three seconds is required to overwrite backups.
11: Only shows save data JKSV can successfully open upon boot.
12: Shows system saves that are tied to an account.
13: Enables restoring system saves and writing to NAND partitions. *This can be dangerous.*
14: Exports save data to ZIP archives instead of unpacked folders.
15: Compression or deflate level used when writing to ZIP. The default value is 6. Lower values can be faster, but offer less compression and space savings. Zero is store, or no compression.
16: Controls the way titles are sorted and displayed.
17: Displays titles as text menus like the original JKSM on 3DS instead of icon grids.
18: Forces English to be used as the language instead of the detected system language.
19: Whether or not to load and display save data that is shared by all users. *This requires a restart to take effect!*
20: Whether or not to load and display BCAT save data. This often used to distribute in-game content and events outside of full updates. *This requires a restart to take effect!*
21: Whether or not to load and display Cache save data. This can be used to store DLC and various other things. *This requires a restart to take effect!*
22: Whether or not the system save data is loaded and displayed. *This requires a restart to take effect!*
23: Moves deleted backups to the _TRASH_ folder instead of permanently deleting them. This only effects local backups.
24: Sets the speed at which transitions and animations occur. Lower is faster. One is instant, four is the slowest before things start breaking.
SettingsMenu: 13: Enable writing to system saves and NAND: %s
19: Show Device or shared save data: %s
SettingsPops: 2: Failed to set JKSV working directory!
TitleOptionConfirmations: 0: Are you sure you want to add #%s# to your blacklist? Once you do this, it will no longer appear on any title list or selection.
1: Are you sure you would like to delete all of the current save backups for #%s#? *This cannot be undone!*
2: Are you sure you would like to reset the save data for #%s#? *This will delete the current save data for the title as if it were never run!*
3: Are you sure you want to delete `%s`'s save data for #%s#? *This will permanently delete it from the system.*
TitleOptionPops: 6: This option is unavailable for system saves!
7: Could not sanitize path for use!
UpdateConfirmation: A new update has been found for JKSV. Would you like to download it now?
UserOptionConfirmations: 0: Are you sure you want to backup the save data for every title found for `%s`? This can take a while.
1: Are you sure you want to create save data for all titles found on your system for `%s`? This can take a while.
2: Are you sure you want to delete all of the save data for `%s`? This is *PERMANENT* and can't be undone.
